subject.normal: [NTG-context] Calling Lua function from an external package

headers.subject: Re: [NTG-context] Calling Lua function from an external package
headers.received: from filter5-til.mf.surf.net (filter5-til.mf.surf.net [194.171.167.221]) by balder.ntg.nl (Postfix) with ESMTP id E9207CA74E for <ntg-context@ntg.nl>; Wed, 29 Sep 2010 15:35:24 +0200 (CEST)
from mail.pontex.cz (mail.pontex.cz [89.233.168.98]) by filter5-til.mf.surf.net (8.14.3/8.14.3/Debian-5+lenny1) with ESMTP id o8TDZNJT022989 for <ntg-context@ntg.nl>; Wed, 29 Sep 2010 15:35:23 +0200

body.para: ... Thanks, it works now! It had to be fixed both in F() and in F2().
(I forgot ";" in MP statement as Lua doesn't require ";".)

(Still it's a bit strange to me that calling F() worked even when the MP
statement in F() was not finished by ";" and F2() was not called.)
On Wed, 29 Sep 2010 15:27:14 +0200, Taco Hoekwater <taco@elvenkind.com> wrote:

quote.quotepara: Let's have T~.lua file which defines a function:
hm, what is this ~ doing there ... avoid such characters! ~ is HOME on some systems
That is true of course, but the problem is much simpler than that:
Make sure you end your metapost expressions with a semicolon.

___________________________________________________________________________________ If your question is of interest to others as well, please add an entry to the
Wiki!
